column5: In this day and age ball players are so babied that they aren't tough nor are they durable. 30 years ago pitchers threw 150 pitches a game not 100... The league leader in complete games each year ends up with less than 10. In the greatest generation try had 20-30
Thought I would take the name of this thread and the song of course for our sign. If you are watching Saturdays game look for us in right field second deck.  â€‹
Have a good one!!!,we'll be looking for you!!  .
That was a pretty rough start. Kids are half asleep already. Haha
Here we are waving our signs at 22 seconds waving our signs. http://wapc.mlb.com/play/?content_id=29184111&c_id=mlb
And once the worst team in MLB leaves town, we go back to losing. If this team wins 70 games it will be a miracle. Doubt I'll watch another game this year, just not worth the aggravation.
Chemistry is important, perhaps they don't have any?  But I think a Joe Torre would fit nicely with this team and make it happen.
Josh Johnson goes 5 innings of shutout ball? Did anyone notice in which direction the Sun set tonight?
I think it has to do with the catcher
Joe torre isn't a good manager he just had a team of hall of famers.  He was fired 4 times and had losing records in Atlanta, St Louis and Texas
IMO the catcher,among others have not been able to work together on a daily basis.More chemistry is what we need.
We had this game and let it get away AGAIN!  .
3 wins in a row!,things may be looking up!
Any one remember,are only Canadian baseball team looks like they could be turning things around. Now that there is not hockey every night,might be time to tune back in? Just sayin/maybe?
3-3 startiing the bottom of the 18th,what a game!

Guys I do Know it's fishing time,but 11 in a row!!!,tied there old record. Going for 12 now.This is the team that was suppose to be. Running on all cylinders ..Exciting time now for you band wagon jumpers.lol.  Let's go guys.Let's get er done  .
Go fishing.
This is better than I've seen them ever, wonder what's going to happen when Reyes gets back, really hope they don't let Muni go..

I was at the game on Friday. Great atmosphere at the dome.   Father's day gift from my wife. Tickets, downtown hotel room and the kids at their grandparent's for the night.   Almost better then a day of fishing.
lol,  Must of been a blast!!!! When there winning it's fun for sure!!!

They've given up, and so have I. Probably won't bother watching another game this season.

It's a head scratcher! They look so baaaaaad!

The kids want to go see a game so I will be taking them to the Saturday game. Middle deck nearest center field second row. Will be wearing a leafs jersey holding a sign "am I too early for training camp?"
When they're down by a bunch of runs try to yell AAAAAAARRRRRGGGOOOOOOOOOS!!!
Maybe a sign that says. "Sens Suck. Go leafs go!" I am open to suggestions.
Trade 'em all. Pathetic
Another crapper last night. Is it the manager???? or the players??? Can't believe the bullpen lost all of their arms at the same time.
With the starters always getting shelled early, they've had to ride the pullpen pretty hard.  Me thinks they're starting to show the wear now.

I find myself still watching,for what reason?,not sure.Houston is in town,worst team in the whole league.Wonder in which inning the jays will blow it?  . We'll find out soon enough.lol.A lot of good that players only meeting did.Maybe todays the start of something better  ..
At the end of the season, maybe even before, I would fire all the training staff. I doubt that this bunch could keep the bat-boy healthy.

In this day and age ball players are so babied that they aren't tough nor are they durable. 30 years ago pitchers threw 150 pitches a game not 100... The league leader in complete games each year ends up with less than 10. In the greatest generation try had 20-30
Nice to see them stick with it and have someone hit with runners in scoring position when they were down.
I agree,but that has been there downfall so far.
Agreed, that's why it was nice to see, Now they have to keep it going.
It's early,but looks as though Seattle is not going to give them any breaks either.  .
Say what you want,unlike the leafs,the Jays are consistant!!  lol.

Unless they make some changes, and fast, they will win no more than 70 games, possibly no more than 60. They are, in a word, pathetic, and embarrassing to watch.  Fans have no right to expect a team to win every game, and no right to expect a winning season every year. But we have every right to expect them to go out and at least play like winners. They aren't even coming close to that.  I've heard that the guys aren't getting down on themselves, and the clubhouse is upbeat. That may be part of the problem. They have no reason to feel upbeat, they should be feeling like crap, mad as hell with themselves, and willing to get mad at each other. They have no excuse at all for any rosy "Oh, everything will be okay, we just have to go on a winning streak" attitude. They also need to be on the receiving end of a lot of boos and chants of AAAAAAARRRRGOOOOOOOSSSS! The time for fan patience is over, as their season probably is.
I think they may of heard you Dave, their hitting today,10-2 top of the eigth,can they hold on though?
If they turn it around now, I take full credit.
There on a two game win streak  ,keep it up!
Hope my cheque is in the mail.
That was nasty, hope J is alright...
Looks bad but he left talking and waved to the crowd
It's encouraging but any number of things could happen. Hopefully we'll hear some reassuring news soon...
Haven't heard anything yet as my cable is in and out. Let's hope the boys win #4 in a row for him!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reports say he's stable, hopefully we learn more soon
I'm now wondering if Gibbons is thinking he's dreaming,this can't be happening. Bottom of the eighth and Boston has tied. All was going well. Nothing new of course,BUT.  .

How can he be dreaming, slumped over a fence chewing tobacco and spitting. The last time he was here it was the same. Cito was a guy players played for. I 'coach' people where I work, very friendly And offer advice, I don't sit and watch.  maybe some of them don't like working with him, he has been around the block a few times.

I do remember him saying a while ago something like"these guys know what they have to do,it's their reputation"along those lines.These guys should be able to win without a manager with there talent just sayin. There is a crap load of money spent on this team. You think we should get rid of the manager ?I'm thinking that's way to easy. The players need to step way,way,up!

I don't usually get into this stuff but, when I go to work and have been for the last 40+ years, I expect my people to do their best. In my early years I've had to work for managers who knew less than me. Now the people I teach are treated with respect and if they do make a mistake it's pointed out as it costs us money to fix. In baseball the season comes to an end and everybody goes home. They all get paid. Just saying he may not be the best person to work for IMOP.

I do agree,but paying good money,get's you better employees,in" most" cases. We all worked for someone who new less than we did at one time.This is professional,Paid way more than your average Joe. The manager and players are not new to the game. We'll have to see how it goes?,they were able to win this one.

I probably make less than my manager, who does not not know what I do (I'm a trade person/ she is called a production manager who does not know how a project is produced. How can people be hired to manage people who they don't know about? I teach on the job to pass on my craft and have for the last 35+ years. Gibbons sits, chews tobacco and spits, on occasion he goes out to the mound. That is called "look I'm working and you have to pay me. Win or lose.! For many years  at this time I'd be sitting on Pigion Lake looking for walleye, times change we get older.  Any true typographers put there? There are only so many left to pass on our skills.
too much faith in the manager. The manager in professional baseball is almost meaningless lol
A better game so far today for the Jays! 10 runs on 10 hits!!,haven't been able to say that for a while.
Jays win!
Don't want to jinx them,but they may finaly have something starting to click?.

Not sure, I missed it, I know it came shortly after they blew the lead. I was hunting for the game on TV, when I gave up and turned the radio on he was gone.  This is from TSN's write up

I gotta admit, I have jumped thebandwagon a bit, I have watched a few games this season. I love the idea of a hot shot knuckle baller on the mound. Too bad he got smoked both games I watched him pitch.

Looks to me as if they bought into all the hype, and think they're the reincarnation of the '27 Yankees. They've got a great bunch of individuals, but instead of going out and making it all come together by playing as a team, they're waiting for it to all come together by itself. Ain't gonna happen. Under Burhles situation of living away from his family because he owns a dog that fits a description that is banned in Ontario....Im sure he will be fine when it comes time to work the mound...heres how creative people learn to cope with stupid laws...This is not Burhles dog Slater but is the one and only Wallace the "Pit Bull"

Camden Yards used to sell out every game regardless of weather but they haven't been drawing well in the last few year

I've watched a number of games this year and find the performance of the team to be lacking. They seem to have started the year with the belief that they have already won the division, based on the hype surrounding the team. Gibbons' hands off approach has not helped as IMHO they seem to lack focus as a team. With Reyes out and an obvious lack of a 2nd baseman, they are weak up the middle. They don't seem to have any idea about how they are going to approach their at bats, just hoping for a pitch to hit rather then having a game plan. I really hope that they get their collective poop in a bag soon, or this will be yet another lost season. Gibbons should pull a "major league" on these guys and start tossing bats around the club house... so far, being the nice guy hasn't yielded any posititve results! HH
Hey don't they televise all of the games? I am off work for the next week and the game Is on but I can't find it on tv.
I'm home now and can't find it.Somebody help!
Seems Dickie wasn't to pleased getting pulled. Sometimes I wonder about Gibbon's coaching ability.

Reyes out up to 3 months!  Dickies outting vs the Red Sox was bad due to a broken finger nail, which you need to be able to throw a knuckler effectively.  they're only a game below 500 ball, no its not the 23-7 aprils we're used to, but its not bad.  glad to see they have a gold glove shortstop in kawasaki as a back up to reyes

Dickie was pulled because he had 2 men on in the seventh. Gibbons is a very good manager. All of the analysts that I read have said he is incredible in bullpen management and controlling his pitching staff. Dickie is a competitor. Plain ad simple and he didn't want to be taken out. Not starter does
Kawasaki needs to find the form he had prior to coming to the MLB from Japan. Ichiro calls him his little brother lol.... Kawasaki has tried to copy Ichiro's style
So much for Gibbon's incredible bullpen management. Putting in Oliver the next Cordero. Dickie  could of easily finished that game and should have.

So it's the Gibbons' fault that Oliver threw a couple of bad pitches? There was no one left in the pen. Loop threw 3 innings the day before and Janssen pitched 2 days in a row.  You can win if you don't score...  And if Dickie was left in there the jays would be 3-7... Dickie's mechanics were off and he was falling too far off the mound changing his arm slot. He was tipping his pitches
this early in the season pitchers are on pretty strict pitch counts to save arms/shoulders, dickie was at 100 pitches when he got pulled, with another possible 30-50 pitches left to go, not worth it
And with his knuckleball that could really be a ton of pitches if its not floating well

My concern is Dickey's knuckle-ball may lack the movement in the Dome?  Dome open we'll have to see.   But his stats at Roger's Center, prior to joining Jays, is not that good:  28 hits in 22 innings of work equals not good. Still gonna root for him and the Jays though.  Hopefully they can work these kinks out soon.
I'm hoping  .
Remember when dickey pitched in the dome he wasn't the same pitcher. It will change. I'm more concerned with buerhle

I was a huge fan and was even @ the dome when they won their first world series but after the second strike I had enough of the Bull and haven't watched a game since.

Drifter same for me. That second strike killed it and I swore I wouldn't watch again until the jays field a contender. If they play well I'll be back otherwise, I will pass. So far they don't look too great. I predict they will lose every game this year.
thought it was 3 strikes and out....not 2, hockey has had more strikes and no one stops watching

This game went nearly how I expected it. The players were too pumped up and lacked execution a "NEW" team always lacks. Biggest difference was the double plays the jays hit into and the passed balls that Arencibia gave up.  Always gave up the passed ball after a Dickey walk which would let the runner advance easily. so on groundballs afterward it would let the runner advance to third rather than Clevland hitting into double plays as well. Clevland got 2 runs because of that tonight.
After last nights game,I wouldn't panic to much.There is still 161 games left lol. RA's pitches are something to watch,the catcher needs even a bigger glove!!
